name: Campaign Monitor modules
title: Campaign Monitor modules

children.text: After connecting to the Campaign Monitor app, you can use the following modules to build your
Triggers immediately when a new subscriber is added to a list.
Enter the name for the webhook.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Select or enter your Client ID.
Select the list you want to monitor for new subscribers.
Adds a subscriber to an existing subscriber list.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Enter the name for the new subscriber.
If the subscriber is in an inactive state or has previously been unsubscribed or added to the suppression list and you set the
, they will be re-added to the list. Therefore, this method should be used with caution and only where suitable. If the
, the subscriber will not be re-added to the active list.
By default, resubscribed subscribers will not restart any automated workflows, but they will receive any remaining emails. However, if you set the
, any sequences will be restarted. The

Select whether the subscriber has given permission to have their email opens and clicks tracked. This value applies to all subscribers with the same email address, within the same client. If you select the
option for an email address, and that address doesn't currently exist in the client, or has no existing value, it is assumed the subscriber has given consent.
Tracking is permitted for this email address.
Tracking is not permitted for this email address.
Does not change the current email address tracking preference.
The ID of the subscriber list to which the subscriber should be added.

When specifying a value for a date custom field, avoid the ambiguous date formats dd/mm/yyyy and mm/dd/yyyy. Instead use an explicit format like yyyy/mm/dd.
Each custom field value has a data limit of 250 characters.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Enter the subscriber's current email address.
Enter the new name for the subscriber.
If the subscriber is in an inactive state or has previously been unsubscribed or added to the suppression list and you set the
, they will be re-added to the list. Therefore, this method should be used with caution and only where suitable. If the
, the subscriber will not be re-added to the active list.
By default, resubscribed subscribers will not restart any automated workflows, but they will receive any remaining emails. However, if you set the
, any sequences will be restarted. The

Select whether the subscriber has given permission to have their email opens and clicks tracked. This value applies to all subscribers with the same email address, within the same client. If you select the
option for an email address, and that address doesn't currently exist in the client, or has no existing value, it is assumed the subscriber has given consent.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Select or map the client ID.
Select or map the list you want to unsubscribe the user from.
Enter the email address of the person you want to unsubscribe.
Removes the webhook that monitors the list subscribers.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Select or map the client ID.
Select or map the list you want to remove the webhook connection from.
Select the webhook you want to remove.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Select or map the client ID.
Select or map the list you want to retrieve the subscriber details from.
Enter the email of the subscriber you want to retrieve.
Sends a Smart Email. The content is defined inside Campaign Monitor and is triggered via
by supplying recipients and, optionally, email variables to merge into the content.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Select or map the ID of the list that contains the Smart Transactional Email.
Enter or map the ID of the Smart Transactional Email.
Enter the email address you want to send the Smart Email to. You can add more comma-separated emails.
You may send to a maximum of 25 recipients across To, CC, and BCC.
Enter the email address you want to send a copy of the Smart Email to. You can add more comma-separated emails.
You may send to a maximum of 25 recipients across To, CC, and BCC.
Enter the email address you want to send a blind copy of the Smart Email to. You can add more comma-separated emails.
You may send to a maximum of 25 recipients across To, CC, and BCC.
Specify attachments to include with the email.
Enter the file name. For example
Enter the file type. For example

Select whether to add all recipients to the subscriber list specified in the Smart Email. Disabled by default. You must have permission from the recipients before adding them to a subscriber list in order to send them marketing email.

Select whether the subscriber has given permission to have their email opens and clicks tracked. This value applies to all subscribers with the same email address, within the same client. If you select the
option for an email address, and that address doesn't currently exist in the client, or has no existing value, it is assumed the subscriber has given consent.
Tracking is permitted for this email address.
Tracking is not permitted for this email address.
Does not change the current email address tracking preference.
Sends a classic email where you supply the message content at the time of sending.

data.label: Campaign Monitor
data.overridedLabel: Create a connection to your Campaign Monitor account

children.text: Select or map the client ID.
Enter the email address for the reply.
Enter the email address you want to send the Smart Email to. You can add more comma-separated emails.
You may send to a maximum of 25 recipients across To, CC, and BCC.
Enter the email address you want to send a copy of the Smart Email to. You can add more comma-separated emails.
You may send to a maximum of 25 recipients across To, CC, and BCC.
Enter the email address you want to send a blind copy of the Smart Email to. You can add more comma-separated emails.
You may send to a maximum of 25 recipients across To, CC, and BCC.
Text component of the email. If not provided, we'll auto-generate the text version from the HTML.
Specify attachments to include with the email.
Enter the file name. For example
Enter the file type. For example
Enable this option if you want to track how many recipients opened the email. For more information refer to
Enable this option to find out how many people clicked links in your email.
Moves any CSS inline to improve compatibility with email clients. Enabled by default.
A name to use for grouping email for reporting. There is a limited number of groups, so this should not be unique or changed frequently.
The ID of a subscriber list to add all recipients to, including CC/BCC. You must have permission from your recipients before adding them to a subscriber list to send them marketing email.

Select whether the subscriber has given permission to have their email opens and clicks tracked. This value applies to all subscribers with the same email address, within the same client. If you select the
option for an email address, and that address doesn't currently exist in the client, or has no existing value, it is assumed the subscriber has given consent.
Tracking is permitted for this email address.
Tracking is not permitted for this email address.
Does not change the current email address tracking preference.

customCSS:
<style>
@media print {
  html, body {
    overflow-x: visible;
  }
}
#tally-widget-button {
  position: fixed !important;
  background-color: #FFFFFF;
  display: none;
  visibility: visible !important;
  opacity: 1 !important;
  color: #0C121D;
  border: 2px solid #0C121D;
  border-radius: 4px;
  align-items: center;
  justify-content: center;
  font-size: 14px;
  font-weight: 600;
  font-family: 'Inter';
  text-align: center;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 6px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.2);
  cursor: pointer;
  z-index: 999999 !important;
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  outline: none;
  touch-action: manipulation;
  pointer-events: auto;
  transform: translate3d(0, 0, 0);
}
.button-text {
  display: inline-block;
  margin-right: 8px;
}
.button-text::before {
  content: attr(data-text);
}
#tally-widget-popup {
  position: fixed;
  background-color: white;
  display: none;
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 10px 20px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.4);
  z-index: 999999;
  overflow: hidden;
  border: 0px solid #0C121D;
  padding-top: 30px;
}
#tally-widget-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 10px;
  right: 10px;
  background: none;
  border: none;
  font-size: 36px;
  font-weight: bold;
  padding: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
  color: #0C121D;
}

  .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
    font-family: 'Inter' !important;
  }

  .dark .ab-plugin-wrapper .ab-link-block-item .ab-link {
    color: #F6F6F6 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column > div > div > div.flex.flex-1.w-full.justify-center.pb-0 > div > div.flex.items-center.pl-0.pr-2.mb-5.xl\:-mt-1\.5 > div > div > div > div:nth-child(1) > div.flex.pr-2.text-gray-500.items-center {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  a.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-public-space-links-wrap .ab-public-space-link:first-of-type {
    border-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  .ab-toc-item-active a{
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }

  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
  #main-column .text-ab-blue-500 {
    text-decoration-color: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-left:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-left:hover .ab-nav-left-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  .ab-nav-right:hover > svg,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .text-gray-300,
  .ab-nav-right:hover .ab-nav-right-text {
     color: #7302D5 !important;
     stroke: #7302D5 !important;
  }
  
#tally-inline-popup {
  position: fixed;
  display: none;
  z-index: 999999;
  width: min(420px, 90vw);
  height: min(550px, 80vh);
  background: #fff;
  color: #0c121d;
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.08);
  border-radius: 12px;
  box-shadow: 0 12px 28px rgba(0,0,0,0.22), 0 2px 6px rgba(0,0,0,0.12);
  overflow: hidden;
  padding: 5px;
}

#tally-inline-popup iframe {
  width: 100%;
  height: 100%;
  border: 0;
  display: block;
  border-radius: 8px;
}

#tally-inline-popup .tip-close {
  position: absolute;
  top: 6px;
  right: 8px;
  width: 32px;
  height: 32px;
  line-height: 28px;
  font-size: 22px;
  text-align: center;
  background: rgba(255,255,255,0.85);
  border: 1px solid rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
  border-radius: 8px;
  cursor: pointer;
}

#main-column a[data-form-url],
#main-column a[data-tally-url] {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
  text-decoration: underline;
  text-underline-offset: 2px;
  text-decoration-thickness: 1.5px;
  font-weight: 600;
}

@media (max-width: 640px) {
  #tally-inline-popup {
    width: min(360px, 94vw);
    height: min(500px, 80vh);
  }
}

#main-column .ab-cta-button a.ab-cta-button {
  background-color: #7302D5;
}

/* Titles in purple */
.ab-link-blocks-wrapper .ab-link-block-item.ab-docs-card-mode .ab-link-block-content-wrap .font-bold {
  color: #7302D5 !important;
}

.ab-tree-navigation-link-active span {
    color: #7302D5 !important;
}

</style>

reusableContentVariables.name: string
reusableContentVariables.description: a list or sequence of characters (like letters, numbers, and symbols) used to represent text in a computer programming.

reusableContentVariables.name: Operations
reusableContentVariables.description: An operation is a single module run to process data or check for new data.

reusableContentVariables.name: Credits
reusableContentVariables.description: Credits (formerly operations) are the currency for running scenarios.

reusableContentVariables.name: Route
reusableContentVariables.description: A route is a path that data can flow through in a scenario, visualized as the dotted lines between modules.
